entries.name: AnchorStateRegistry
entries.description: Contains the latest confirmed state root that can be used as a starting point in a dispute game. It specifies which game type can be used for withdrawals, which currently is the PermissionedDisputeGame.

entries.name: DelayedWETH
entries.description: Contract designed to hold the bonded ETH for each game. It is designed as a wrapper around WETH to allow an owner to function as a backstop if a game would incorrectly distribute funds.

entries.name: PreimageOracle
entries.description: The PreimageOracle contract is used to load the required data from L1 for a dispute game.

entries.name: AggchainECDSAMultisig
entries.description: System contract defining the X Layer Aggchain logic. It only enforces bridge accounting (pessimistic) proofs to protect the shared bridge while the Aggchain state transitions are not proven. They must instead be signed by 1 aggchainSigner(s).

CONSENSUS_TYPE.description: 0 - ECDSA sig verification, 1 - aggchainVkey verification (read by the pessimistic program)

forceBatchAddress.description: If this changes to the ZERO address, an update to the risk rosette is probably needed, since forcing batches is open to everyone.

AGGCHAIN_TYPE.description: 0: ECDSA sig verification, 1: limited to vkeys in AggchainGateway with 1 as second byte

entries.name: MIPS
entries.description: The MIPS contract is used to execute the final step of the dispute game which objectively determines the winner of the dispute.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

receivedPermissions.description: sole address that can force batches.

entries.name: SystemConfig
entries.description: Contains configuration parameters such as the Sequencer address, gas limit on this chain and the unsafe block signer address.

gasLimit.description: Gas limit for blocks on L2.

eip1559Denominator.description: volatility param: lower denominator -> quicker fee changes on L2

receivedPermissions.description: sign state transitions (replaces state validation for this aggchain).

entries.name: OptimismMintableERC20Factory
entries.description: A helper contract that generates OptimismMintableERC20 contracts on the network it's deployed to. OptimismMintableERC20 is a standard extension of the base ERC20 token contract designed to allow the L1StandardBridge contracts to mint and burn tokens. This makes it possible to use an OptimismMintableERC20 as this chain's representation of a token on the host chain, or vice-versa.

entries.name: OptimismPortal2
entries.description: Central message and gas token (dOKB) bridge of the OP stack part of this deployment. It allows for permissioned state proposals without public challenges, and forced transactions.

paused.description: Whether the contract is paused or not. Determined by the SuperchainConfig contract PAUSED_SLOT. Here it pauses withdrawals. If this is paused, also the L1CrossDomainMessenger and ERC-20, ERC-721 deposits are paused.

entries.name: SuperchainConfig
entries.description: This is NOT the shared SuperchainConfig contract of the OP stack Superchain but rather a local fork. It manages the `PAUSED_SLOT`, a boolean value indicating whether the local chain is paused, and `GUARDIAN_SLOT`, the address of the guardian which can pause and unpause the system.

receivedPermissions.description: it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.

entries.name: L1ERC721Bridge_neutered
entries.description: Used to bridge ERC-721 tokens from host chain to this chain.

entries.name: DisputeGameFactory
entries.description: The dispute game factory allows the creation of dispute games, used to propose state roots and eventually challenge them.

entries.name: L1StandardBridge_neutered
entries.description: This OP stack bridge contract has been modified to disallow ETH and ERC-20 bridging.

receivedPermissions.description: upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

entries.name: AddressManager
entries.description: Legacy contract used to manage a mapping of string names to addresses. Modern OP stack uses a different standard proxy system instead, but this contract is still necessary for backwards compatibility with several older contracts.

entries.name: PermissionedDisputeGame
entries.description: Same as FaultDisputeGame, but only two permissioned addresses are designated as proposer and challenger.

entries.name: L1CrossDomainMessenger
entries.description: Sends messages from host chain to this chain, and relays messages back onto host chain. In the event that a message sent from host chain to this chain is rejected for exceeding this chain's epoch gas limit, it can be resubmitted via this contract's replay function.
